newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Investors gun-shy on options.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Investors gun-shy on options.

text.p: Investors grew gun-shy toward most individual U.S. equity options as stocks posted a second-straight sharp selloff, traders said Monday.
Rod Jamieson at EVEREN Securities in Chicago said activity even in the normally busy technology stock options was relatively slow Monday.
"Even though the stocks are moving, the options are drying up," he said.
But the most active options were on technology stocks including Intel Corp, Microsoft Corp and International Business Machines Corp.
Overall, however, the busiest individual equity option was the Philip Morris Cos Inc June 125 call, which traded about 10,600 contracts.
The option fell 3/4 to 3-5/8 as the underlying stock dropped 3 to 114-1/8.
Most of the volume was done in several blocks of 1,000 contracts. The option's open interest through last Thursday was 12,724 contracts.
Another active non-technology stock option was the Wal-Mart Stores Inc May 27-1/2 put, which traded 5,000 contracts.
The option, which had open interest of 90 contracts, added 1/8 to 1/2. Walmart shares fell 1-1/8 to 27-7/8.
Options on shares of Ascend Communications Inc were fairly active as the stock tumbled 11-1/4 to 40-3/4 after it said it would acquire Cascade Communications Corp.
Options trading in Ascend was steady in most strikes, particularly the 40 and 45 puts and calls. The heaviest volume was in the April 45 calls, which traded about 2,755 contracts.
The June 60 call traded a total of about 2,600 contracts.
Ascend options trade on four of the five options exchanges.
Cascade options were not heavily traded. Cascade shares finished at 26-3/8, down 2.
